required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Birth Experience During COVID-19 Confinement (Confinement and Fostering Intrapartum Care)

brief_summary.textblock: Different studies have demonstrated that the absence of companionship during labor and childbirth may be responsible for a negative birth experience, an increased risk of postnatal depression and/or post traumatic stress disorders. These situation may also have a negative impact on mother-child interaction, on marital and family relationship and on the rate of maternal suicide in postpartum. However, these previous results cannot be extrapolated in the current context where the absence of the companionship is imposed by the confinement framework. The objective of the CONFINE study is to assess, for the first time, the birth experience of women in the context of limited social support in the immediate post-partum period due to confinement, as well as the associated over-risk of mental disorders, compared to a post-partum without social restriction.

primary_outcome.measure: "Labor Agentry Scale questionnaire" score in immediate post-partum (duration of hospital stay)
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 16 months

secondary_outcome.measure: "Labor Agentry Scale questionnaire" score at two months after birth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 16 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Edinburg Postnatale Depression Scale questionnaire" score at two months after birth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 16 months
secondary_outcome.description: To detect suspicion of Post-Partum Depression

secondary_outcome.measure: "Impact of Event Scale - Revised questionnaire" score at two months after birth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 16 months
secondary_outcome.description: To detect suspicion of Post traumatic stress syndrome

secondary_outcome.measure: Breastfeeding statement at two months after birth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 16 months

secondary_outcome.measure: "SF-12 Quality of life questionnaire" score at two months after birth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 16 months

secondary_outcome.measure: "SF-12 Quality of life questionnaire" score in immediate post-partum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 16 months

arm_group.description: Women who have given birth during the confinement period in relation to COVID-19 and who have been subject to restrictions concerning companionship during labor and/or immediate postpartum.

Women who have given birth and whose pregnancy began after the end of the confinement period (in relation to COVID-19) and who have not been subject to restrictions concerning companionship during labor and/or immediate postpartum.

intervention.description: Self-administered questionnaires once during the post-natal hospitalization and a second time 7 to 9 weeks after the delivery (at home)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Woman who is >= 18 years old
- Woman having just given birth from 37 weeks of gestation (singleton pregnancy)
- Woman affiliated to a social security
- Woman with a level of understanding of written French sufficient to answer the questionnaires.
- Woman having received complete information on the organization of the research and having given her informed consent in written form.
Inclusion criteria specific to the experimental group: woman who have recently given birth during the confinement period due to covid-19.
Inclusion criteria specific to the control group: woman who have just given birth and whose pregnancy began after the confinement period due to covid-19.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major mentioned in articles L.1121-6 and L-1121-8 of Health Public Code.
- Woman with psychiatric disorders such as depressive syndrome
- Woman tested with Covid-19 positive at the time of the delivery
- Newborn with congenital abnormalities
- Stillbirth

overall_official.affiliation: Centre Hospitalier Régional Universitaire de Nancy

facility.name: Centre Hospitalier Régional Universitaire de Nancy
